content:
**[AI]** Cowork Skills - Claude Cowork Workflows

**Links**

Website: https://www.cowork-skills.com

**Introduction**

A curated library of Claude Cowork (Computer Use) workflows with copy-paste prompt templates, covering file organization, data extraction, and code automation with safety guidance.

Tech Stack: Next.js 14 + Tailwind CSS + Contentlayer

**Key Features**

- **Prompt Library**: Ready-to-use workflows for Claude Cowork tasks
- **File Organization**: Prompts for cleaning and structuring download folders
- **Data Extraction**: Extract structured data from PDFs and screenshots
- **Code Automation**: Generate tests and refactor code with guided prompts
- **Safety Guide**: Practical guardrails for sandboxing and permissions

**Preview**

![Cowork Skills - Claude Cowork Workflows](https://www.cowork-skills.com/og-image.png)

title: ã€å·¥å…·è‡ªèã€‘Printery | Print for Figma
content:
**[Tool]** Printery | Print for Figma

**Links**

Website: https://www.printery.app

**Introduction**

Printery (Print for Figma) is a Figma plugin that exports press-ready PDFs with CMYK conversion, bleed, crop marks, and PDF/X support. It streamlines print workflows with DPI checks, multi-page export, and spot color options.

Tech Stack: Figma Plugin + CMYK + PDF/X

**Key Features**

- **CMYK Conversion**: Export press-ready PDFs using ICC profiles and custom color mapping
- **Bleed & Crop Marks**: Automatic bleed, trim, and crop mark handling for print workflows
- **DPI Checker**: Detect low-resolution assets before export
- **Multi-page PDF Export**: Combine pages into a single production-ready PDF/X
- **Spot Color Support**: Pantone colors with density control and overprint options

**Preview**

![Printery | Print for Figma](https://www.printery.app/og-image.png)

title: ã€å·¥å…·è‡ªèã€‘æ–¹è¡Œè„¸å›¾æ ‡ç”Ÿæˆå™¨
content:
**[Tool]** Square Face Icon Generator

**Links**

Website: https://www.squarefaceicongenerator.co/

**Introduction**

An online avatar generator focused on Square Face aesthetics. As a great Picrew alternative, it offers minimalist retro-style personalized avatar customization.

Tech Stack: Next.js 16 + Tailwind CSS 4 + Prisma + Zustand

**Key Features**

- **Avatar Customization**: Thousands of combinations including hairstyles, facial features, skin tones, and accessories
- **Random Generation**: One-click random matching for quick design inspiration
- **Multi-language Support**: Native support for 6 languages including English, Chinese, Korean, and Japanese
- **HD Export**: One-click save high-resolution PNG images, no watermark
- **Completely Free**: No registration or login required

**Preview**

![Square Face Icon Generator](https://www.squarefaceicongenerator.co/og-image.png)

title: I Built PulseDaily: a Localâ€‘First, Noâ€‘Login Habit Tracker (Next.js + Tailwind)
content:
I just shipped **PulseDaily** â€” a mobileâ€‘first habit tracker that runs entirely in your browser. **No signup, no login**. Your data stays on your device (localStorage by default).

Live site: [PulseDaily habit tracker](https://pulsedaily.codezs.online/)

---

## Why I built it

Iâ€™ve tried a lot of habit trackers, and I kept running into the same friction:

- Youâ€™re forced to create an account before you can even try it
- Too many features up front = decision fatigue
- â€œGentle remindersâ€ exist, but the setup is often more work than the habit itself

PulseDaily is my attempt at a **tiny, fast, lowâ€‘commitment** alternative: open it, add a habit, and get through Day 1.

---

## What PulseDaily does

### 1) Habit management (add/edit/delete)

Create habits quickly, keep names short, and adjust anytime. Itâ€™s designed for oneâ€‘hand mobile use.

### 2) 3â€‘state daily checkâ€‘ins + a Momentum bar

Each habit has three daily states:

- `0` â€” not started
- `1` â€” partially done
- `2` â€” fully done

The Momentum bar counts **only fully done** habits. The idea is to avoid â€œgaming the progress barâ€ and instead keep the signal honest.

### 3) Reminders: custom interval + custom message

You can create up to **20** fixedâ€‘interval reminders:

- Enable/disable toggle
- Edit / delete
- **Test now** (sends one notification + sound, without changing your schedule)
- Notifications use the browser **Notification API**
- Optional **beep sound** via WebAudio

> Note: This intentionally does **not** try to keep reminding you after the page is closed. Itâ€™s meant to be lightweight.

### 4) Shareable template landing pages (oneâ€‘click import)

For cold start, I added a few template pages (Study / Fitness / Focus). Instead of sharing a generic homepage link, you can share a **specific â€œstarter setâ€** like:

[Study habit tracker template](https://pulsedaily.codezs.online/templates/study)

Users can click **Use this template** and PulseDaily will write those habits into localStorage and redirect to `/`.

---

## Tech stack (quick overview)

- Framework: **Next.js** (App Router)
- Styling: **TailwindCSS**
- Storage: **localStorage** (localâ€‘first)
- Notifications: Browser **Notification API**
- Sound: **WebAudio** (short beep)
- Analytics: **Google Analytics** (early funnel visibility)

### Why localStorage?

I wanted â€œtry it instantlyâ€ to be the default. For many people, a small habit tracker doesnâ€™t need accounts or sync â€” it needs **low friction**. If usage proves itâ€™s worth it, optional sync can come later.

---

## Cold start: what I did to make links work better

Early on, the biggest challenge is not building features â€” itâ€™s getting people to click and understand the product quickly. So I focused on three basics:

1. **OpenGraph/Twitter cards** so shares look credible and clickable
2. **robots.txt + sitemap** so search engines can discover pages faster
3. **Template landing pages** so a link can match a personâ€™s intent (study vs fitness vs focus)

These are small changes, but they can make a big difference when youâ€™re starting from zero.

---

## Run locally

```bash
npm install
npm run dev
```

Then open `http://localhost:3000`.

---

## Whatâ€™s next (roadmap)

If people find it useful, the next things Iâ€™ll prioritize:

- A simple **Share** button on template pages (copy link + suggested text)
- Clearer onboarding so firstâ€‘time users can succeed in 10 seconds
- Better analytics events (e.g. `template_apply`, `enable_reminder`, `export_data`)
- Optional: import flow to match export/backup

---

## Feedback wanted

If you try it, Iâ€™d love to hear:

- Is the firstâ€‘time experience obvious?
- Do reminders feel helpful or annoying?
- Which templates would you want next? (ADHD, writing, meditation, gym, etc.)

Link: [PulseDaily (habit tracker)](https://pulsedaily.codezs.online/)  
Thanks for reading!
